intro: Bidaria montana, commonly known as the mountain bidirectional, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. Bidaria montana is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
